title: Static Analysis

android.permission.READ_CONTACTS.description: Allows an application to read all of the contact (address) data stored on your phone. Malicious applications can use this to send your data to other people.

android.permission.RECEIVE_BOOT_COMPLETE.description: Allows an application to start itself as soon as the system has finished booting. This can make it take longer to start the phone and allow the application to slow down the overall phone by always running.

android.permission.RECEIVE_SMS.description: Allows application to receive and process SMS messages. Malicious applications may monitor your messages or delete them without showing them to you.

android.permission.SEND_SMS.description: Allows application to send SMS messages. Malicious applications may cost you money by sending messages without your confirmation.

com.google.android.apps.googlevoice.perm.description: Allows application to receive and process SMS messages. Malicious applications may monitor your messages or delete them without showing them to you.

certificate_findings: Application is signed with a code signing certificate

Application is signed with v1 signature scheme, making it vulnerable to Janus vulnerability on Android 5.0-8.0, if signed only with v1 signature scheme. Applications running on Android 5.0-7.0 signed with v1, and v2/v3 scheme is also vulnerable.
Application is signed with SHA1withRSA. SHA1 hash algorithm is known to have collision issues.
Certificate algorithm might be vulnerable to hash collision

manifest_analysis.title:
Application Data can be Backed up
[android:allowBackup=true]
manifest_analysis.desc: This flag allows anyone to backup your application data via adb. It allows users who have enabled USB debugging to copy application data off of the device.
manifest_analysis.name: Application Data can be Backed up [android:allowBackup=true]

manifest_analysis.title:
Broadcast Receiver (.ApiHandler) is Protected by a permission, but the protection level of the permission should be checked.
Permission: com.dririan.RingyDingyDingy.EXECUTE_COMMAND
protectionLevel: dangerous
[android:exported=true]
manifest_analysis.desc: A Broadcast Receiver is found to be shared with other apps on the device therefore leaving it accessible to any other application on the device. It is protected by a permission. However, the protection level of the permission is set to dangerous. This means that a malicious application can request and obtain the permission and interact with the component. If it was set to signature, only applications signed with the same certificate could obtain the permission.
manifest_analysis.name: is Protected by a permission, but the protection level of the permission should be checked.[android:exported=true]

metadata.description: Query Database of SMS, Contacts etc

metadata.cwe: CWE-330: Use of Insufficiently Random Values
metadata.description: The App uses an insecure Random Number Generator.

metadata.cwe: CWE-89: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an SQL Command ('SQL Injection')
metadata.description: App uses SQLite Database and execute raw SQL query. Untrusted user input in raw SQL queries can cause SQL Injection. Also sensitive information should be encrypted and written to the database.

metadata.cwe: CWE-532: Insertion of Sensitive Information into Log File
metadata.description: The App logs information. Sensitive information should never be logged.

FCS_RBG_EXT.1.1.choice: The application use no DRBG functionality for its cryptographic operations.

FCS_STO_EXT.1.1.choice: The application does not store any credentials to non-volatile memory.

FCS_CKM_EXT.1.1.choice: The application generate no asymmetric cryptographic keys.

FDP_DEC_EXT.1.1.choice: The application has access to no hardware resources.

FDP_DEC_EXT.1.2.choice: The application has access to ['address book'].

FDP_NET_EXT.1.1.choice: The application has no network communications.

FDP_DAR_EXT.1.1.choice: The application does not encrypt files in non-volatile memory.

FMT_MEC_EXT.1.1.choice: The application invoke the mechanisms recommended by the platform vendor for storing and setting configuration options.

FTP_DIT_EXT.1.1.choice: The application does not encrypt any data in traffic or does not transmit any data between itself and another trusted IT product.

strings: "permission_handle_internal_command_description" : "Used exclusively by RingyDingyDingy for internal commands."
"permission_handle_command_description" : "Allows the application to add new commands to RingyDingyDingy."

"whats_new_message" : "Welcome to the new version of RingyDingyDingy!
 
 This version brings a few bug fixes as well as a few new features.
 Please read the instructions that you'll see when you tap OK for information on how to use this app.
 If you have any problems, please e-mail us directly at ringydingydingy@dririan.com.
 If you post a negative review on Google Play, we can't respond to you and help fix the problem.
 
 New features:
 * Activation logging that tells you what commands were activated, when they were activated, who activated them, and what app was used (can be turned off in Settings)
 * Multiple pages will now accumulate in one dialog
 * New icon!
 * You can now choose what ringtone RDD will use
"
"preferences_send_sms_replies_disable_summary" : "Tap to disable sending replies to text messages"

"main_header_pager_enabled" : "To send a page to this device, send:
"<pager_code> (message to display)""
"sms_help" : "Send "rdd <code> <cmd>". <cmd> is one of: help, lock, ring, stop."
"permission_execute_command_description" : "Allows the application to execute RingyDingyDingy commands."
"sms_unknown_command" : "Unknown command. Send "rdd <code> help" for a list of commands."
"preferences_set_code_summary" : "Tap to type in your own activation code"
"main_header_remote_lock_enabled" : ", or remotely lock your device by replacing it with "lock"."
"preferences_generate_code_summary" : "Tap to generate a new random code"
"preferences_remote_lock_warning" : "Please note that you MUST deactivate remote locking before uninstalling RingyDingyDingy! Keeping it active will give the error "Uninstall not successful.""
"preferences_pager_code_message" : "Enter a new pager activation code below. Note that it cannot contain spaces."
"preferences_log_max_entries_summary" : "Tap to change the maximum number of log entries to keep (currently <count>)"
"sms_lock_needs_permission" : "Sorry, but I can't do a remote lock. Remote locking is disabled."
"preferences_pager_error" : "Sorry, your code wasn't valid. It cannot contain spaces. Please try again."
"sms_ring_success" : "The remote ring has been initiated. Send "rdd <code> stop" to stop the remote ring."
"preferences_log_enable_summary" : "Tap to enable logging when a command is activated, who activated it, and what app was used"
"preferences_pager_disable_summary" : "Tap to disable receiving pages (uses a separate activation code)"
"main_header_settings_holo" : ", tap the Settings icon on the action bar."
"sms_ring_was_ringing" : "Sorry, but I can't start a remote ring. A remote ring has already been initiated."
"sms_stop_was_not_ringing" : "Sorry, but I can't stop the remote ring. No remote ring was initiated."
"main_header_log_instructions_holo" : "tap the View icon on the action bar."

"preferences_set_code_dialog_message" : "Please enter your new activation code. It must be between four and eight characters (letters, numbers, and symbols) long and cannot contain spaces. Please note that anyone with access to your device can view your code at any time, so don't use anything secret like a PIN code!"
"preferences_log_disable_summary" : "Tap to disable logging when a command is activated, who activated it, and what app was used"
"preferences_send_sms_replies_enable_summary" : "Tap to enable sending replies to text messages"
"device_admin_prompt" : "RingyDingyDingy needs device administration privileges to enable remote locking. Please accept this if you want to lock your device remotely."
"preferences_pager_enable_summary" : "Tap to enable receiving pages (uses a separate activation code)"

"main_header" : "To perform a remote ring, send:
"rdd <code> ring"
to this device, without quotes.

You can stop a remote ring by replacing "ring" with "stop"<remote_lock>

<pager>

<log>

To change your activation code, available commands, and enabled triggers (ways to send commands to RingyDingyDingy)<settings>"
"preferences_set_code_error" : "Sorry, your code wasn't valid. It must be between four and eight characters (letters, numbers, and symbols) long and cannot contain spaces."
"main_header_log_enabled" : "Activation logging is enabled. To see the activation log, <instructions>"
"preferences_notification_enable_summary" : "Tap to show a notification that lets you quickly enable/disable RingyDingyDingy"
"preferences_notification_disable_summary" : "Tap to hide a notification that lets you quickly enable/disable RingyDingyDingy"
"log_clear_prompt" : "Are you sure you want to clear the activation log?"
"sms_lock_needs_froyo" : "Sorry, but I can't do a remote lock. Remote locking needs Android 2.2 (Froyo) or newer."
"preferences_pager_code_summary" : "Tap to set a new pager activation code"

high.title: Application vulnerable to Janus Vulnerability
high.description: Application is signed with v1 signature scheme, making it vulnerable to Janus vulnerability on Android 5.0-8.0, if signed only with v1 signature scheme. Applications running on Android 5.0-7.0 signed with v1, and v2/v3 scheme is also vulnerable.

high.title: Certificate algorithm might be vulnerable to hash collision
high.description: Application is signed with SHA1withRSA. SHA1 hash algorithm is known to have collision issues.

[android:allowBackup=true]
This flag allows anyone to backup your application data via adb. It allows users who have enabled USB debugging to copy application data off of the device.

warning.title: Broadcast Receiver (.ApiHandler) is Protected by a permission, but the protection level of the permission should be checked.
warning.description:
Permission: com.dririan.RingyDingyDingy.EXECUTE_COMMAND</br>protectionLevel: dangerous [android:exported=true]
A Broadcast Receiver is found to be shared with other apps on the device therefore leaving it accessible to any other application on the device. It is protected by a permission. However, the protection level of the permission is set to dangerous. This means that a malicious application can request and obtain the permission and interact with the component. If it was set to signature, only applications signed with the same certificate could obtain the permission.

warning.title: App uses SQLite Database and execute raw SQL query. Untrusted user input in raw SQL queries can cause SQL Injection. Also sensitive information should be encrypted and written to the database.

App uses SQLite Database and execute raw SQL query. Untrusted user input in raw SQL queries can cause SQL Injection. Also sensitive information should be encrypted and written to the database.

secure.title: This application has no privacy trackers
secure.description: This application does not include any user or device trackers. Unable to find trackers during static analysis.

hotspot.title: Found 4 critical permission(s)
hotspot.description:
Ensure that these permissions are required by the application.

android.permission.READ_CONTACTS (dangerous): read contact data - Allows an application to read all of the contact (address) data stored on your phone. Malicious applications can use this to send your data to other people.

android.permission.RECEIVE_SMS (dangerous): receive SMS - Allows application to receive and process SMS messages. Malicious applications may monitor your messages or delete them without showing them to you.

android.permission.SEND_SMS (dangerous): send SMS messages - Allows application to send SMS messages. Malicious applications may cost you money by sending messages without your confirmation.

com.google.android.apps.googlevoice.permission.RECEIVE_SMS (dangerous): receive SMS - Allows application to receive and process SMS messages. Malicious applications may monitor your messages or delete them without showing them to you.
